description: From Latin meditatus, past participle of meditari (“to think or reflect upon, consider, design, purpose, intend”), in form as if frequentative of mederi (“to heal, to cure, to remedy”); in sense and in form near to Greek μελετῶ (meletô, “to care for, attend to, study, practise, etc.”).

verbs.description: meditate (third-person singular simple present meditates, present participle meditating, simple past and past participle meditated)

entries.meaning: (intransitive) To contemplate; to keep the mind fixed upon something; to study.
(intransitive) To sit or lie down and come to a deep rest while still remaining conscious.
